data.text: @vola2vola although a bit weird to think that we blame china for covid, yet they seem to suffer the most because of covid and the policies..

@vola2vola One suggested they are headed for meltdown in demographics because of one-child policy and meltdown in food supply....if they carry on like this maybe that person was on to something (although he argued on other grounds..)
@vola2vola Is this the one that Bill geyts was talking about, that there will be new viruses...
@juliajeler @vola2vola I would use the word “struggling” very carefully. China has recorded just a little bit more than 500 cases in the last 24 hours. 0 deaths.
@vola2vola How on earth will they deal with omicron if they handle it this way? supplychain problems will be their last problem in such case..no one can work, produce etc?

@vola2vola As shown by Hong Kong, covid is hitting areas that have suppressed all previous waves hard

They are struggling due to no natural immunity
@vola2vola @dobbs_ddobell1 Explains why G and I in China just won't bounce despite easing P.
